title: How to Make Passion Fruit Margaritas

steps.headline: Fill a small saucer with coarse sea or margarita salt.
steps.description: Measure about a tablespoon of salt and make sure it's more towards the edges. Depending on the quantity of margaritas you are planning to make, add a tablespoon or several to the saucer.

steps.headline: Rim the margarita glass.
steps.description: Use a lime wedge and rub the juice around the rim of the glass.

steps.headline: Dip the glass rim into the salt.
steps.description: As you lift up the glass, gently swirl it to make a more cleaner appearance.

steps.headline: Add crushed ice to a cocktail shaker.
steps.description: Fill it about halfway with ice.

steps.headline: Measure and pour the ingredients into the shaker.
Shake the contents.
steps.description: Secure the lid on and vigorously shake it for a few seconds. You will know when the contents are cold when you see condensation building up on the outside of the shaker.

steps.headline: Strain the contents.
steps.description: Attach a strainer on the cocktail shaker (if the shaker doesn't have one) and strain it into four margarita glasses.

text: Preparing the Glass Fill a small saucer with coarse sea or margarita salt. Measure about a tablespoon of salt and make sure it's more towards the edges. Depending on the quantity of margaritas you are planning to make, add a tablespoon or several to the saucer. Rim the margarita glass. Use a lime wedge and rub the juice around the rim of the glass. Dip the glass rim into the salt. As you lift up the glass, gently swirl it to make a more cleaner appearance. Preparing the Margarita Add crushed ice to a cocktail shaker. Fill it about halfway with ice. Measure and pour the ingredients into the shaker.  Shake the contents. Secure the lid on and vigorously shake it for a few seconds. You will know when the contents are cold when you see condensation building up on the outside of the shaker. Strain the contents. Attach a strainer on the cocktail shaker (if the shaker doesn't have one) and strain it into four margarita glasses. Garnish the margaritas.  Finished.
